    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Description copied from class: Task
        Global unique task identifier, e.g. IDEA-00001. It's important that its format is consistent with TaskRepository.extractId(String), because otherwise task won't be updated on its activation. Note that this ID is used to find issues and to compare them, so (ideally) it has to be unique. In some cases task server doesn't offer such global ID (but, for instance, pair (project-name, per-project-id) instead) or it's not what users want to see in UI (e.g. notorious id and iid in Gitlab). In this case you should generate artificial ID for internal usage and implement Task.getPresentableId().
        Specified by:
        getId in class Task
        Returns:
        unique global ID as described
        See Also:
        Task.getPresentableId(), TaskRepository.extractId(String), TaskManager.activateTask(Task, boolean)

      • getNumber

        public java.lang.String getNumber()
        Description copied from class: Task
        Per-project issue identifier. Default behavior is to extract project name from task's ID. If your service doesn't provide issue ID in format PROJECT-123 be sure to initialize it manually, as it will be used to format commit messages.
        Overrides:
        getNumber in class Task
        Returns:
        project-wide issue identifier
        See Also:
        Task.getId(), TaskRepository.getCommitMessageFormat()

      • setNumber

        public void setNumber(java.lang.String number)

      • getProject

        public java.lang.String getProject()
        Description copied from class: Task
        Name of the project task belongs to. Default behavior is to extract project name from task's ID. If your service doesn't provide issue ID in format PROJECT-123 be sure to initialize it manually, as it will be used to format commit messages.
        Overrides:
        getProject in class Task
        Returns:
        name of the project
        See Also:
        Task.getId(), TaskRepository.getCommitMessageFormat()
